description: A tour of the miraculous machine that is your body.

slides.title: Organization of Body
slides.content:
# Hierarchy ü™ú

1. **Cells** (Neuron)
2. **Tissues** (Nerve tissue)
3. **Organs** (Brain)
4. **Organ Systems** (Nervous System)
5. **Organism** (You!)

Homeostasis: Keeping internal conditions stable (Temp, pH, Sugar) despite outside changes.

slides.title: Digestive System
slides.content:
# Fuel Processing üçî

- **Mouth**: Mechanical chew + Enzyme (Amylase).
- **Stomach**: Acid bath (HCL) + Pepsin.
- **Small Intestine**: Nutrient absorption (Villi).
- **Large Intestine**: Water absorption.
- **Liver/Pancreas**: Chemical factories assisting digestion.

slides.title: Circulatory System
slides.content:
# The Transport Network ‚ù§Ô∏è

- **Heart**: 4-chambered pump.
- **Arteries**: Carry Oxygenated blood AWAY.
- **Veins**: Carry Deoxygenated blood TOWARD.
- **Capillaries**: Tiny exchange points for gases/nutrients.

slides.title: Respiratory System
slides.content:
# Gas Exchange ü´Å

Goal: Get $O_2$ In, $CO_2$ Out.
- **Alveoli**: Tiny air sacs in lungs where exchange happens.
- **Diaphragm**: Muscle that pulls air in (negative pressure).

slides.title: Systems Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Where does oxygen enter the blood stream?

slides.title: Nervous System 1
slides.content:
# The Control Center üß†

**CNS (Central)**: Brain + Spinal Cord.
**PNS (Peripheral)**: Nerves to body.

- **Neuron**: The messenger cell.
- **Synapse**: Gap between neurons where chemicals (Neurotransmitters) jump.

slides.title: Nervous System 2
slides.content:
# Fight or Flight üêØ

Autonomic Nervous System (Automatic):
- **Sympathetic**: "Fight or Flight" (High heart rate, pupils dilate).
- **Parasympathetic**: "Rest and Digest" (Calm down, digestion on).

slides.title: Musculoskeletal System
slides.content:
# Support and Move üí™

- **Bones**: Structure, blood cell factory (Marrow).
- **Muscles**: Only pull, never push.
  - Skeletal (Voluntary)
  - Smooth (Involuntary - guts)
  - Cardiac (Heart)
- **Tendons**: Muscle to Bone.
- **Ligaments**: Bone to Bone.

slides.title: Excretory System
slides.content:
# Waste Removal üöΩ

**Kidneys**: Filter blood.
- **Nephron**: Filtering unit.
- Removes Urea, excess salts, water.
- Produces Urine.

Crucial for water balance and blood pressure.

slides.title: Endocrine System
slides.content:
# Chemical Messengers ‚úâÔ∏è

**Hormones**: Slow, long-lasting signals in blood.
- **Pituitary**: Master gland (Growth).
- **Thyroid**: Metabolism.
- **Adrenal**: Adrenaline/Cortisol (Stress).
- **Pancreas**: Insulin (Sugar).

slides.title: Immune System 1
slides.content:
# Defense Force üõ°Ô∏è

- **Innate**: Barriers (Skin), Fever, Inflammation. (General).
- **Adaptive**: Specialized hunters. (Specific).

slides.title: Immune System 2
slides.content:
# Special Ops ü¶†

- **B-Cells**: Make **Antibodies** (Missiles that tag invaders).
- **T-Cells**: Kill infected cells directly.
- **Memory Cells**: Remember enemies for next time (Immunity).

slides.title: Reproductive System
slides.content:
# Next Generation üë∂

- **Gametes**: Sperm (Testes) and Eggs (Ovaries).
- **Fertilization**: Meet in Fallopian tube forms Zygote.
- Hormones (Testosterone, Estrogen) drive changes.

slides.title: Integumentary System
slides.content:
# The Wrapper üß¥

**Skin**: Largest organ.
- Protection against pathogens/UV.
- Temperature regulation (Sweat).
- Sensation (Touch).

slides.title: Senses
slides.content:
# Input Devices üëÅÔ∏è

- **Vision**: Rods (Light) & Cones (Color) in Retina.
- **Hearing**: Cochlea hairs vibrate.
- **Smell/Taste**: Chemical receptors.
- **Touch**: Pressure/Heat/Pain sensors.

slides.title: Energy Metabolism
slides.content:
# Burning Calories üî•

- **BMR (Basal Metabolic Rate)**: Energy to exist at rest.
- **ATP**: The energy currency.
- Excess energy stored as Glycogen (short term) or Fat (long term).

slides.title: Homeostasis Examples
slides.content:
# Balance Beam üßò

- **Too Hot**: Sweat, blood vessels widen (Vasodilation).
- **Too Cold**: Shiver, vessels shrink (Vasoconstriction).
- **High Sugar**: Insulin stores it.
- **Low Sugar**: Glucagon releases it.

slides.title: Physiology Summary
slides.content:
# Recap üìù

- 11 Organ Systems work in harmony.
- **Homeostasis** is the goal.
- **Communication** happens via Nerves (Fast) and Hormones (Slow).
- **Defense** keeps invaders out.

Your body is the most complex machine in the known universe!
